basic.floral_language:
Dietes iridioides Sweet
Floriography: beautiful, freedom, and the sun 
Dietes iridioides Sweetes are very beautiful flowers, also called as the blue butterfly, belongs to the medium-sized perennial root plant. 
Dietes iridioides Sweet flower shape is unique, the petals are large and gorgeous, and most of the flowers have the rainbow color and the stripes, so its Latin Dietes iridioides Sweet is derived from the Greek myth of the goddess of the rainbow.
basic.blooming: Flowering period April-May, viewing period 1-2 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate sunshine, also resistant to half shade, avoid strong light
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply fertilizers once every 10-15 days in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
